Detailed Description

Abstract superclass that describes a packet queue.

Contains two virtual methods to enqueue and dequeue packets from the queue.

Member Function Documentation

virtual Packet* Queue::dequeue (  uint32  maxWaitTime  )  [pure virtual]
 

Get a packet from the queue, but maximum a given time.

This means that this method might return NULL if the time-out is reached before any packet is available in the queue.

Returns:
A packet from the queue, NULL is returned if timed out.

Implemented in PacketQueue, and Fifo.

virtual Packet* Queue::dequeue (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Get a packet from the queue.

This method should never return NULL. If the queue is empty it should hang until any packet is available.

Returns:
A packet from the queue.

Implemented in PacketQueue, and Fifo.

virtual bool Queue::enqueue (  Packet *  p  )  [pure virtual]
 

Insert a new packet into this queue.

Parameters:
p The packet to enqueue.
Returns:
True on success, false otherwise.

Implemented in PacketQueue, and Fifo.

virtual uint32 Queue::getStatistics (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Get the statistics of this queue.

This is intened to be a measurement of the time to process the packtes in this queue.

Returns:
A value of the statistics for this queue.

Implemented in PacketQueue, and Fifo.
